meanings.definition: To make someone unable to hear by a loud noise.
meanings.sent1: The explosion near the building could bedeafen anyone nearby.
meanings.sent2: The construction work next door might bedeafen us if it gets any louder.
meanings.sent3: The loud music from the party threatened to bedeafen the neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm's roar seemed to bedeafen the entire town.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the jet taking off was so loud it could bedeafen a person.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to lose their hearing by a loud noise.
meanings.sent1: The sudden blast of the horn could bedeafen the driver momentarily.
meanings.sent2: The continuous honking of the cars could bedeafen anyone in the vicinity.
meanings.sent3: The screeching brakes threatened to bedeafen the passengers on the bus.
meanings.sent4: The constant drilling noise seemed to bedeafen the workers in the construction site.
meanings.sent5: The loud sirens from the fire trucks could bedeafen a person if they were too close.
